value.0: I really must file my report with Lord Nasher. Excuse me.

Comment.value:
CONDITION: Quest has not been completed.
                      Quest has not been accepted.
                      Sedos has not spoken to this PC before.
                      High Charisma

value.0: Who are you, and why did the guards let you in here? There's enough trouble in this district without thugs like you - wait, you aren't new recruits, are you?
Then you're wasting my time! Away with you.
Oh my! You have my sincerest apologies. We have been having a bit of trouble as of late.
Please, allow me to introduce myself. I'm Sedos Sebile - headmistress of the Adventurer's Academy as well as acting militia captain here in Neverwinter.
So I see that you must be here for gold and fortune. No matter the cause, we need more able-bodied soldiers in our ranks.
Your demeanor is welcome in these troubling times. I am eager to see what good you can do out there.

But before I send you into your first mission, you should be at least combat ready. Seek out Herban downstairs, and tell him you are here for training. Learn what you can from him, and report back to me when you are done.
You don't have a choice. Until I hear from Herban, there is nothing more for us to discuss. Now get moving!
Good luck, recruit.
Something I can do for you?
Yes, on your way, then.
Look, there's a crisis out there and I have little time for friendly banter. What I need are warm bodies to throw at a problem outside of regular militia duties.
Sure. I'll tell you what I know.
Alright. What else do you need?

We have a large prison facility in the Pensinsula district. It would seem with the plague, the prisoners are getting a lot more violent. So violent in fact, they killed most of the wardens and we have lost control of some of the floors.
That's about as much I was told by a messenger. You should report to the head gaolor Alaefin. He should be inside the prison compound, actually.
The "Sword Coast Boys" are a band of bandits and ruffians who have become much more brazen since the outbreak of the Wailing Death. They appear to have headquarters in the sewers.
You'll need to speak to Harben Ashensmith to find out more. You can find him right in front of the aqueducts in the Docks.
It's quite bad. There appears to be zombies flooding out of the Great Graveyard. We had to setup a military blockade just to keep it from spilling into the district.
Drake is in charge of that mission. You should speak to him to get further information.
Indeed! I have heard much of your progress. The turmoil has been reduced thanks to your efforts. Again, you've proven yourself to be much more than a recruit.
Now that the districts are under control, putting a stop to the Wailing Death is the next step. For this, you are to report to Lady Aribeth de Tylmarande. She's asked for you personally.
You can find her in her office at Castle Never. Here's the gold as promised. Oh, and you can take this magic ring I had from my old adventuring days. May it serve you well, <FirstName>.
I see. I have been monitoring your progress in the academy and you have shown yourself to be quite capable. Very well then.
You know firsthand that we are in dark times, with the wailing death and all. The entire city has pretty much plunged into chaos.
In fact, several of our districts are battling it's own problems alongside the plague. We need to restore order to those districts before anything else!
Here in the Beggar's Nest, we've been hearing reports about an undead infestation. Something about the corpses rising from the grave and attacking people.
Speak with Drake for more information. He can be found stationed with the other militia outside the Great Graveyard, located south of this district.
Besides that, there has also been reports about the 'Sword Coast Boys', who are a violent group of criminals that have become more brazen with the onslaught of the plague.
I have a contact in the docks district. Go talk to Harben Ashensmith, and lend your assistance. He can be found right outside the aqueducts.

Finally, in the Peninsula district, the prison has become more rowdy with the onslaught of the plague and rioting has occured. Most of the wardens are either dead from the plague or killed by the inmates.
The head gaoler Alaefin is the man to speak to about this. He's in the prison itself, located in his office on the first level.
Report back to me when those districts are under control. Are you up to the task, recruit?
Indeed it is. I hope you have this written down, because I'm not saying it twice. On your way, recruit. And don't forget to get help from a henchman from the Trade of Blades.

Is gold truly what motivates you? Fine. You'll get a reward for each district you bring order to, and you'll also get a larger reward when all three are saved. Be sure to team up with a henchman from the Trade of Blades.
We don't have any other options. If you don't think you can handle it yourself, try enlisting a henchman from the Trade of Blades.
On your way, recruit. Be sure to get help from a henchman from the Trade of Blades -  they are on the same mission as you.
If you want some shiny new equipment, don't forget to see Berna before you head out. She's our quartermaster and will happily sell you some gear.

Before you go, I will cast a ward of revival. It is a permanent ward that will revive you after combat if you have a nearby ally or friend that is still alive. This effect extends to any henchman you may have, but not ordinary followers.

The strain of each revival will sap your consitutition, however. You won't be able to get revived after dying a few times like this, in which case you'll need to get healed at a temple or get a true resurrection like a Raise Dead spell.
Ah, I see we have another fresh recruit from the academy. You guys really should team up and be on your way. Good luck out there!
No, I'm not. I must be in the wrong place.
Maybe. And just who might you be?
Yes, I am.
Enough with the pleasantries. When do I get paid?
Pleased to meet you, Miss Sebile. How may I be of assistance?
I'm a seasoned <class>. I think I know my way around things.
I'll be on my way, then.
I should get going.
I'd like to ask you some questions.
Tell me about the troubles in the districts again.
I don't have any more questions regarding the districts.
Tell me about this prison riot.
Tell me about the "Sword Coast Boys" in the sewers.
Tell me about the undead infestation in the Beggar's Nest.
The districts should be under control now.
Farewell, Sedos.
I've completed my training and and I am now ready for a mission.
This is a lot to take in.
The pay better be good.
This sounds like a suicide mission.
I'll see what I can do.
